history.content: I believe the grade buckets, once established and made available on the CS61A page, are final. Having taken 61A with Hilfinger last year, I don't recall any curve or significant change to the policy.
I believe the grade buckets, once established and made available on the CS61A page, are final. Having taken 61A with Hilfinger last year, I don't recall any curve or change to the policy.

I believe the grade buckets, once established and made available on the CS61A page, are final. Having taken 61A with Hilfinger last year, I don't recall any curve or change to the policy. 

https://cs61a.org/articles/about.html#tests-and-grading

children.subject: Hilfinger does not curve, but if you are something 0.25 points away from a grade bucket you may be able to ask a TA to bump you up. The exams are designed to have a 50% average.
Doesn't curve buckets are set, but points round up, so if the bucket is 250 for an A example, and you have 249.5 he'll round you up but that's it.

history.content: On the syllabus he says he won't curve. I am debating how hard I should study for the final because I need like 90% on the final to get an A or 60% on the final to get an A-. That's according to the syllabus though, so I want to hear somebody who have taken his class.
history.subject: Does Hilfinger Curve 61A?
